title: Typefaces for Alternative publication
content:
Hi  
Im putting an alternative magazine together  
and Im looking for some cool fonts.  
Im using News Gothic, Futura BC,Impact etc.,  
But they seem old now.  
Any suggestions?  
Thanks!!

 [‹ Arabic style text](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218141025/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14012 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please help Identify font!! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218141025/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13989 "Go to next forum topic")
author: digitalartisan

comments.content: What type of magazine is this - subject matter, audience, etc...

\> Im looking for some cool fonts.

Is the readership of this magazine primarily looking for “cool”, irrespective of content? Because otherwise you should look deeper than what we might think is cool. Chris has the right idea; and then there’s the more technical stuff, like article length, paper type, etc...

hhp

Thanks  
It’s a Music/Entertainment magazine.(glossy)  
Mostly Rock, with the usual club,restaurant,etc., guide.  
We Interview local Las vegas’ band as well as famous ones.  
Thanks for your help!
You could go the tried and true route of using Amplitude for (almost) everything. Christian’s own personal coolness just seems to rub off on every magazine that uses his type.

Its often not what fonts that are used but how they are used that can make a publication fresh (different). A tabloid here is using all caps, condensed and bold/black at a huge size that jumps the spread to sensationalize their articles. Just some thoughts
